data.sentence: The word مِنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: At; near; with; from; presence; in the presence of; for. Ladun: Particle of a place or preposition.Ladai/Lida = At; near; with; from; presence; in the presence of; for. A particle of place or preposition. The meanings of Ladun and Ladai and Lida are the same.
data.sentence: The word لَدُنْكَ comes from the root ل د ن and is associated with the meanings: At; near; with; from; presence; in the presence of; for. Ladun: Particle of a place or preposition.Ladai/Lida = At; near; with; from; presence; in the presence of; for. A particle of place or preposition. The meanings of Ladun and Ladai and Lida are the same.

data.meanings: to be close, near, follow, be up to.tawalla (prf. 3rd. m. sing.) - turneth away.tawallau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.) - they turned away.tawallaitum (prf. 2nd. m. pl.) - ye turned away.yatawalla (impf. 3rd. m. pl.) - he turns away.
data.sentence: The word وَلِيًّا comes from the root و ل ي and is associated with the meanings: to be close, near, follow, be up to.tawalla (prf. 3rd. m. sing.) - turneth away.tawallau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.) - they turned away.tawallaitum (prf. 2nd. m. pl.) - ye turned away.yatawalla (impf. 3rd. m. pl.) - he turns away.

data.meanings: To fear, to be afraid/frightened/terrified, to put fear into another, diminish or lessen or take from, to take little by little from a thing, take from the sides of a thing, slaughter or fight.
data.sentence: The word خِفْتُ comes from the root خ و ف and is associated with the meanings: To fear, to be afraid/frightened/terrified, to put fear into another, diminish or lessen or take from, to take little by little from a thing, take from the sides of a thing, slaughter or fight.

data.meanings: made/produce fire, allude to equivocally/ambigiously, meant such a thing pretended another, hide/conceal/cover, behind a thing covering/concealing, aider/follower, The Book of The Law (revealed to Moses).
data.sentence: The word وَرَاءِي comes from the root و ر ي and is associated with the meanings: made/produce fire, allude to equivocally/ambigiously, meant such a thing pretended another, hide/conceal/cover, behind a thing covering/concealing, aider/follower, The Book of The Law (revealed to Moses).

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word وَكَانَتِ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: It (food) was wholesome or approved in its result, easy to swallow, not attended by trouble, quick in digesting, light to the stomach, to descend well, to be salubrious in its air (land), in the habit of doing what is approved and shunning what is held base, preserve the soul from filthy actions, to be possessed of manly perfection or manly virtue or moral goodness, give food (on the occasion of building a house or marrying).
data.sentence: The word امْرَأَتِي comes from the root م ر ا and is associated with the meanings: It (food) was wholesome or approved in its result, easy to swallow, not attended by trouble, quick in digesting, light to the stomach, to descend well, to be salubrious in its air (land), in the habit of doing what is approved and shunning what is held base, preserve the soul from filthy actions, to be possessed of manly perfection or manly virtue or moral goodness, give food (on the occasion of building a house or marrying).

data.meanings: to cut/wound/slay, hamstrung, produce no result, be barren (e.g. womb).
data.sentence: The word عَاقِرًا comes from the root ع ق ر and is associated with the meanings: to cut/wound/slay, hamstrung, produce no result, be barren (e.g. womb).

data.meanings: to give/grant/bestow, dedicate, offer as a present/gift.
data.sentence: The word فَهَبْ comes from the root و ه ب and is associated with the meanings: to give/grant/bestow, dedicate, offer as a present/gift.
